uk.ac.ebi.reactionblast.tools.rxnfile

Class MDLV2000RXNWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openscience.cdk.io.ChemObjectIO
      • org.openscience.cdk.io.DefaultChemObjectWriter
        • uk.ac.ebi.reactionblast.tools.rxnfile.MDLV2000RXNWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, org.openscience.cdk.io.IChemObjectIO, org.openscience.cdk.io.IChemObjectWriter

    public class MDLV2000RXNWriter
extends org.openscience.cdk.io.DefaultChemObjectWriter
    Writes a reaction to a MDL rxn or SDF file. Attention: Stoichiometric coefficients have to be natural numbers. 
     MDLRXNWriter writer = new MDLRXNWriter(new FileWriter(new File("output.mol")));
 writer.write((AtomContainer)molecule);
 writer.close();
    See {

      • setRdFields

        public void setRdFields(java.util.Map map)
        Here you can set a map which will be used to build rd fields in the file. The entries will be translated to rd fields like this:
        > <key>
        > value
        empty line
        Parameters:
        map - The map to be used, map of String-String pairs

      • write

        public void write(org.openscience.cdk.interfaces.IChemObject object)
           throws org.openscience.cdk.exception.CDKException
        Writes a IChemObject to the MDL RXN file formated output. It can only output ChemObjects of type Reaction
        Parameters:
        object - class must be of type AtomContainer or MoleculeSet.
        Throws:
        org.openscience.cdk.exception.CDKException
        See Also:
        ChemFile
